body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#17553](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17553.html) (wallet: Remove out of date comments for CalculateMaximumSignedTxSize by instagibbs)
* [#17526](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17526.html) (Use Single Random Draw In addition to knapsack as coin selection fallback by achow101)
* [#17524](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17524.html) (psbt: handle unspendable psbts by achow101)
* [#17518](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17518.html) (refactor, wallet: Nuke coincontrol circular dependency by hebasto)
* [#17371](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17371.html) (Refactor: Require scriptPubKey to get wallet SigningProvider by achow101)
* [#17331](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17331.html) (Use effective values throughout coin selection by achow101)
* [#17290](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17290.html) (Enable BnB coin selection for preset inputs and subtract fee from outputs by achow101)
* [#17264](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17264.html) (rpc: set default bip32derivs to true for psbt methods by Sjors)
* [#16377](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16377.html) ([rpc] don't automatically append inputs in walletcreatefundedpsbt & fundrawtransaction by Sjors)
* [#16365](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16365.html) (Log RPC parameters (arguments) if -debug=rpcparams by LarryRuane)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
"to ensure a sufficient feer is attained for the requested feerate" ?
nit: add a reference to `txNew.vin[nIn]` since it's used 3 times here
`txNew.vin[nIn]` is used three times here, just set a variable to reference it?

Not immediately obvious to me why this change is necessary. 

Probably requires more extensive comment?
In other words, how did selection of inputs work before this?

CTxOuts are needed for fee estimation and knowing the values of the outputs being selected. For inputs the wallet knows about, it would fetch the outputs from the wallet (obviously). Otherwise it would basically ignore them. So to support external inputs, either the user would have to enter the output info (bad UX IMO) or we can fetch it from the UTXO set.
Done
Done
Done
Done
Updated the help
can you also reflect the updated help into walletcreatefundedpsbt verbatim? It's helpful for usage.
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase
Also updated the help of `walletcreatefundedpsbt`

This seems like an advanced feature, so maybe move to "options"?
diff_hunk:
@@ -3157,6 +3206,25 @@ static UniValue fundrawtransaction(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
                         "This boolean should reflect whether the transaction has inputs\n"
                         "(e.g. fully valid, or on-chain transactions), if known by the caller."
                     },
+                    {"solving_data", RPCArg::Type::OBJ, RPCArg::Optional::OMITTED_NAMED_ARG, "Keys and scripts needed for producing a final transaction with a dummy signature. Used for fee estimation during coin selection.\n",

body:
Why not a reference instead of a pointer?

Is there any reason not to move this to `SigningProvider` as a method?
I don't think this really belongs as part of options. It's not like a setting, just additional data needed.
diff_hunk:
@@ -3157,6 +3206,25 @@ static UniValue fundrawtransaction(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
                         "This boolean should reflect whether the transaction has inputs\n"
                         "(e.g. fully valid, or on-chain transactions), if known by the caller."
                     },
+                    {"solving_data", RPCArg::Type::OBJ, RPCArg::Optional::OMITTED_NAMED_ARG, "Keys and scripts needed for producing a final transaction with a dummy signature. Used for fee estimation during coin selection.\n",

body:
I changed this to a reference.

I don't think this really makes sense as part of SigningProvider. SigningProvider is to provide data for signing and is agnostic of what is being signed and how it is being signed. To add this to SigningProvider would violate that. Also, that would imply adding every other signing function to SigningProvider as well, and I don't think we should do that.
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase
